intro: Gonolobus squiresii, commonly known as the Squires' go-on-lot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in suitable environments. Gonolobus squiresii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
